intro: Niphobolus sticticus, commonly known as the spotted liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a small, terrestrial plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. The plant has a distinctive appearance with a thalloid body that is often covered in small, round tubercles or bumps. Its reproductive structures, called sporophytes, are usually found on the upper surface of the thallus. Niphobolus sticticus is primarily found in temperate regions and is often used as an indicator species for certain ecological conditions.
